DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether bortezomib, cytarabine, and dexamethasone are effective in the treatment of relapsed or refractory mantle cell lymphoma after 1 to 3 lines of previous treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Trial of Bortezomib, Cytarabine, and Dexamethasone in Mantle Cell Lymphoma
DOC.criteria: Pathologically confirmed mantle cell lymphoma Relapse or progression after 13 lines of previous chemotherapy with or without immunologic agents ECOG performance status 2 or less Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function i. White blood cells ≥ 3,000 /ul ii. Absolute neutrophil count ≥ 1,000 /ul iii. Platelets ≥ 50,000 /ul iv. Hemoglobin ≥ 9.0 g/dL v. Total bilirubin < 2 times upper limit of normal vi. AST, ALT < 2.5 times upper limit of normal vii. Serum creatinine < 1.5 times upper limit of normal Previously treated with 4 or more lines of chemotherapy with or without immunologic agents Previously treated with bortezomib Treated with a cytarabinecontaining regimen as the last line and within 6 months before registration Other cancer diagnosed within 5 years before registration Uncontrolled symptomatic CNS involvement of mantle cell lymphoma Uncontrolled systemic infection Inherited immunodeficiency disease or AIDS Pregnancy Breastfeeding Peripheral neuropathy of grade 3 or higher Other health conditions considered to be inappropriate for this trial in the primary physician's opinion
